reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayied, in my last travel to Europe in exactly seven different hotels. This one, was, by far, the best one.
reviews.title: Superb hotel - stay there, you won´t regreat

reviews.text: Excellent stuff, very good breakfast, good daily rate, very confortable and cozy room.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.text: I recommend it, go without thinking twice.
reviews.title: Nice but overated
Eurostars Das Letras Hotel
reviews.text: Just to ilustrate how good they are, one of the hotel valet driver´s accidently smash a little bit the door of my rented car against a wall. Not only he assumed what he did, but the hotel also talked to the company I rented and paid the repair. And all of this without asking nothing. They just solved it.
Congratulations to the stuff.
reviews.title: to recomend, perfectly situated, very good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eurostar das letras in Lisbon is an outstanding hotel...The quality of service and personal attention is first class. The attitude of the personnel is excellent. My wife and I
reviews.title: great hotel. outstanding service a place to be well received...

reviews.text: stayed for a total of ten nights in this hotel (five in april and five nights in May of 2010.
reviews.title: Comfortable and upscale

reviews.text: I would categrize this hotel as a five star hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable and whenever anything was needed whether it be an extra towel or creamer for the in room coffee pot it was brought immediately. The breakfast provided ( always should be purchased in the initial reservatios as otherwise it is extremely expensive. The hotel is
reviews.title: Smart Hotel with Attentive Staff
Disappointing for a "5 star"
reviews.text: located on a quiet street about a five - seven minute walk from the main avenue (liberdade) very walkable,,,but be prepared to climb up a deep street to return to the hotel. Dinner service is limited, but there are nice snacks and light items at the bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parkings is avaliable probably for about $20-25.00 US per day. I recommend not driving in Lisbon as parking is nearly impossible and taxis are very cheap and overall I would say that 90% of the taxicab drivers are honest...so that is a better bet...Restaurants are within walking distance and thare are a number to choose from..Enjoy Lisbon..it is a great city and the folks are very friendly.
reviews.title: Well placed, excellent value, breakfast adequate, room very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in July 2010.
reviews.title: Great stay - not 5 star though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: I know there’s been debate about the location, but we thought the location was great, given the cost and quality of room you were getting. Yes, there is a steep walk up a hill which is noticeable in hot weather, but all of Lisbon is hilly. The metro stop is at the bottom of the hill, less than 10 minutes. I should’ve timed it, but I think it was 15-20 minutes into the shopping/restaurant districts, and to the buses/trains.
reviews.title: Perfect stay, very nice hotel - no deduction of points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms/amenities: the room was modern, the bed was very comfortable, had flat screen TV, spacious bathroom, A/C. For me, the room could’ve been a little cleaner though, we had a large dead bug on the ceiling which should’ve been cleaned-up (didn’t want to look up when laying in bed), and a dirty bidet towel in the bathroom, and in general the room wasn’t sparkling clean. I was also disappointed that we didn’t get the fancier shower with the multiple heads. Our showerhead was actually broken and we had to shove a juice box behind the bar to keep it stable. So as other reviewers mentioned, this is definitely not a 5 star hotel. It just lacked the cleanliness, and attention to detail (ensuring nothing is broken in the room) of a high-end hotel.
reviews.title: excellence!

reviews.text: Service: was okay, front desk staff gave little detail with directions so not totally helpful, and we had them check a restaurant for us, and they incorrectly told us it was open when it was actually closed, a big deal since it was a significant cab ride away from the hotel. They were very nice upon check-in though.
reviews.title: the best hotel ive stayed in for a very long time! Gorgeous room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suggestions: we really enjoyed our meal at the Moroccan restaurant (Flor de Laranja). The lamb dish with prunes is delicious. Just don’t order the prawns, they overcook them, but will maintain they’re cooked perfectly. This seemed to be a pattern in Portugal, maybe because I’m from Vancouver I’m used to fish being more on the rare side, but the lady at front desk confirmed that in Portugal they like to cook their shellfish “to the very end,” lol. After a couple instances of overcooked prawns/lobster, I stuck to grilled fish was always cooked to perfection! Of course Pasteis de Belem in Belem is not to be missed either when in Lisbon.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with exceptional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on Hotels.com for three nights at about $100/night. We could not be more pleased with the hotel. It is very chic and modern. The location is away from the hustle and grit of the main squares, which we liked. It’s still convenient for site-seeing as it is just off of the Avenida de Liberdad and near the Metro.
reviews.title: True Five Star Service

reviews.text: During our stay, every member of the staff was attentive and did an exceptional job. Their commitment to 5-star service is obvious. Our welcome was warm and genuine. Check-in and check-out were both quick and accurate. We were shown to our room (345) and given a quick tour of the features of the room. There is no view from this room. The king size is comfortable and made up in high quality linens. There is a pillow menu and extras were promptly delivered at my request. The slick bathroom has both a shower and tub. The shower is really neat with an overhead rain-shower, several wall-mounted back massage jets, and also a wand. The water temperature stayed as selected and the pressure was good. There were plenty of big, soft towels. The amenities included toothbrush/paste, shaving kit, nice shampoo, bath gel and creamy body lotion which were restocked each day. Bathrobes, slippers, iron/board, safe, ample closet and drawer space, and a mini-bar and teapot are provided. The lighting was good and convenient with bed side controls. The air-conditioning works well. The temperature hit 100-degrees F during the day but our room was nice and cool.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, friendly efficient staff, all needs met

reviews.text: The hotel has a small business center with two computers for guests to use with no charge. There is also free wi-fi in the room.
reviews.title: Theft from our Hotel Room

reviews.text: Breakfast was not included in our rate, so we did not eat at the hotel. Instead, we bought a six-pack of pastéis de nata, the famous Portuguese custard tarts, the night before and enjoyed it with a cup of coffee made in the room. There is a fantastic seafood restaurant down the hill from the hotel. We ate dinner here twice! The shrimp and potato dish is delicious. The beers are cold and cheap.
reviews.title: Average - high price - poor breakfast

reviews.text: We arrived in Lisbon by bus from Sevilla, Spain. It was easy to take the Metro from the bus station to the Avenida stop, a 10-minute walk to the hotel. You can approach from two ways, the shorter is very steep and a bit of a struggle with our luggage. The long way is less steep and passes by a coffee-shop/deli. There is an airport bus stop right near the hotel on Avenida de Liberdad. We planned to take the bus to the airport and had been waiting for about 15-minutes when another couple asked us to share a cab. They had been waiting for nearly 30-minutes and had grown anxious. We split the fare and it cost us 5Euros including the tip. The bus would have been a little over 6Euros for both of us.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel
